description: {"blocks":[{"key":"619hm","text":"This methodology has been developed for the use of MiFish-U and MiFish-E primers multiplexed with Platinum SuperFi II (2X) and Zymo clean up under a touchdown PCR program, aimed at the specific amplification of fish species from estuarine samples with inhibitors. The primers, originally developed by Miya et al., 2015, and Kawato et al., 2021, target the hypervariable region of the mitochondrial DNA 12S rRNA gene in fish species including Elasmobranchii. Platinum SuperFi II (2X) is a high fidelity polymerase and is well suited for multiplexing as it can work using primers with different melting temperatures at 60°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"e89fn","text":"Before preparing the PCR mix and adding DNA, thoroughly clean all work surfaces with a 5%-10% bleach solution, followed by distilled water (dH2O). Ensure that surfaces are cleaned both before and after use. Always wear lab coats, gloves, and change them when moving between different work areas to prevent cross contamination. Clean pipettes regularly using a 5%-10% bleach solution, followed by a rinse with dH2O. Dispose of all hazardous waste in designated disposal areas to maintain a safe and orderly laboratory environment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: eDNA PCR,Multiplexing,Platinum SuperFi II,Fish detection,Optimization,Environmental DNA,12S rRNA gene,Estuarine,MiFish primers,Zymo clean up,PCR

MiFish, a set of universal PCR primers for metabarcoding environmental DNA from fishes: detection of more than 230 subtropical marine species. Royal Society open science, 2(7), p.150088.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":286,"length":26},{"style":"italic","offset":314,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck26s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3a38","text":"Kawato, M., Yoshida, T., Miya, M., Tsuchida, S., Nagano, Y., Nomura, M., Yabuki, A., Fujiwara, Y. and Fujikura, K., 2021. status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3fdbe","text":"Before setting up the PCR mix, purify the DNA using the Zymo OneStep PCR Inhibitor Removal Kit as indicated by the manufacturer (CAT: D6030 or D6035). After the clean up, dilute the DNA at a 1:5 ratio. Follow the the Guidelines \u0026 Warnings for lab space preparation and clean up. See Description above for a general overview of this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":134,"length":5},{"key":1,"offset":143,"length":5},{"key":2,"offset":217,"length":21},{"key":3,"offset":283,"length":11}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7BA9679AB2F111EE8D050A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.zymoresearch.com/products/onestep-pcr-inhibitor-removal-kit"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"84C0E634B2F111EE8D050A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.zymoresearch.com/products/onestep-pcr-inhibitor-removal-kit"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CB5B5131BC5B42C485852B33425995ED","url":"https://www.protocols.io/edit/optimized-pcr-protocol-for-fish-detection-in-compl-c7jdzki6/guidelines"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AB51D9C7B9C54912A58F15C1F8DC14FA","url":"https://www.protocols.io/edit/optimized-pcr-protocol-for-fish-detection-in-compl-c7jdzki6/description"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bflgh","text":"Prepare an equimolar mix of MiFish-U-F and MiFish-E-F (with TruSeq or Nextera illumina adapters) of the Forward primers and an equimolar mix of the Reverse primers (final concentration for each primer in the PCR mix is 5 μM). See the Materials section above for details.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":234,"length":9}],"data":{}},{"key":"5l13q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54h7e","text":"Prepare the Forward primer mix with equimolar concentration (final 5 μM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ngmt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2jibd","text":"Prepare a combined Forward primer mix:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jdt3","text":"- 90 μL of PCR grade water ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96ruv","text":"- Add 5 μL of MiFish-U-F stock solution (100 μM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fj8a8","text":"- Add 5 μL of MiFish-E-F stock solution (100 μM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu4gp","text":"This results in a mix containing both Forward primers at a final concentration of 5 μM each.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt15t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bf99s","text":"Prepare a combined Reverse primer mix:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v39h","text":"- 90 μL of PCR-grade water ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bs5b","text":"- Add 5 μL of MiFish-U-R stock solution (100 μM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3aod3","text":"- Add 5 μL of MiFish-E-R stock solution (100 μM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7iq07","text":"This results in a mix containing both Reverse primers at a final concentration of 5 μM each.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"730840B5513E445599D7DC7B0B2C6533","url":"https://www.protocols.io/edit/optimized-pcr-protocol-for-fish-detection-in-compl-c7jdzki6/materials"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e75ng","text":"IMPORTANT: The PCR is run in triplicate for each sample and the products are pooled together before running the E-Gel and preparing the Library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl2kl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22v8a","text":"Set up the PCR reaction for a total reaction volume of 20 μl by mixing the following components (amounts are per sample):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"434ft","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kc45","text":"PCR grade H2O: 2 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"975dk","text":"Platinum SUPERFI II Master Mix (2X): 10 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"khs0","text":"Forward primer mix (5 μM): 2 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bepl","text":"Reverse primer mix (5 μM): 2 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1jqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asi5j","text":"Aliquot 16 μL of the mixture into each well to be used in the 96 well PCR plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2polm","text":"Add 4 μL of DNA (Zymo cleaned and diluted at a 1:5 ratio)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8904r","text":"Total Volume: 20 μl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ah9o6","text":"We use a touchdown protocol by setting up an initial annealing temperature of 69.5°C to increase the specificity for the target.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qu3t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abumi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fj9mt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fa590","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Temperature","Duration","Description"],"colWidths":[100,100,"312"],"data":[["95°C","3 minutes","Initial denaturation"],["94°C","30 seconds","Denaturation"],["69.5°C","30 seconds","Annealing (-1.5°C each cycle, touchdown)"],["72°C","90 seconds","Extension"],["-----------","-------------","Repeat steps 2-4 for 13 cycles"],["94°C","30 seconds","Denaturation"],["60°C","30 seconds","Annealing"],["72°C","45 seconds","Extension"],["-------------","-------------","Repeat steps 6-8 for 25 cycles"],["72°C","10 minutes","Final extension"],["4°C","Hold","Storage temperature"]],"guid":"DA33EF5D0D89462AA2C03448CC5CEE88","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["95°C","3 minutes","Initial denaturation"],["94°C","30 seconds","Denaturation"],["69.5°C","30 seconds","Annealing (-1.5°C each cycle, touchdown)"],["72°C","90 seconds","Extension"],["-----------","-------------","Repeat steps 2-4 for 13 cycles"],["94°C","30 seconds","Denaturation"],["60°C","30 seconds","Annealing"],["72°C","45 seconds","Extension"],["-------------","-------------","Repeat steps 6-8 for 25 cycles"],["72°C","10 minutes","Final extension"],["4°C","Hold","Storage temperature"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajjsl","text":"After amplification, check the success of the PCR reaction by loading the sample onto a 2% agarose gel using a 1:3 dilution of the products and a 100 bp ladder (diluted 1:10).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ep05","text":"NOTE: In the same lane, the gel should show one main band slightly below 300 bp. In some cases another band will appear (mainly off-target) at slightly below 400 bp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: 12S PCR Metabarcoding Protocol for Fish Detection in Estuarine Samples

versions.title: 12S PCR Metabarcoding Protocol for Fish Detection in Estuarine Samples
versions.title_html: 12S PCR Metabarcoding Protocol for Fish Detection in Estuarine Samples

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"8mukv","text":"This protocol has been optimized on a Biorad T-100 Thermocycler and was not tested on machines from other manufacturers. For the preparation of PCR mix, always utilize PCR grade water. Ensure that spaces for pre-PCR and post-PCR procedures are distinctly separated. Additionally, maintain a separate area for mixing PCR reagents apart from where DNA is added. Strictly follow cleaning protocols for the working surfaces.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
